required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Contrast-enhanced MRI in Children 2 Months to <2 Years
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label, Multi-center, Two-stage, Age Stratified, Pharmacokinetic, Safety, and Efficacy Study in Children 2 Months to < 2 Years of Age Undergoing Magnevist Injection Enhanced MRI

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine pharmacokinetics, safety and efficacy of Magnevist in children 2 months to < 2 years of age

detailed_description.textblock: Safety issues are addressed in the AE section

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Diagnostic Adequacy - Open-label Clinical Investigators (Per Protocol Set)
primary_outcome.description: A clinical judgment by the open-label Clinical Investigators (CIs) as to whether ("yes") or not ("no") the CI could make a diagnosis from the image.

primary_outcome.measure: Dose Determined by Blinded Readers to be Superior for Diagnosis
primary_outcome.description: Dose superiority was a calculation based upon the Blinder Readers' assessment of 4 visualization parameters

primary_outcome.measure: Paired-dose Comparison of Number of Participants With Dose Superiority Determined for 4 Lesion Visualization Variables - Blinded Readers
primary_outcome.description: For each participant, the Blinded Reader indicated which dose had better contrast enhancement, better border delineation, clearer internal morphology, and provided more diagnostic information. The dose chosen for 3 or 4 of these variables was the selected dose for that Reader and participant. If each dose was superior on 2 variables, the dose which provided more diagnostic information was selected for that participant. The dose selected for the majority of participants was the dose selected by that Reader; if chosen by 2 or 3 Readers, it was the selected dose.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 to 45 min and 4 to 8 hours post injection
primary_outcome.description: Total clearance is the fraction of the volume of distribution (Vd) which is completely purified per unit of time and depends also on the plasma half-life of the drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 to 45 min and 4 to 8 hours post injection
primary_outcome.description: CL/BW = total clearance normalized by BW

primary_outcome.measure: PK Analysis - Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 to 45 min and 4 to 8 hours post injection
primary_outcome.description: Vss is an estimate of drug distribution independent of the elimination process and is proportional to the amount of drug in the body versus the drug plasma concentration at steady-state.

primary_outcome.measure: PK Analysis - Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) /Body Weight (BW)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 to 45 min and 4 to 8 hours post injection
primary_outcome.description: Vss/BW = volume of distribution at steady state normalized by body weight

primary_outcome.measure: PK Analysis - Area Under the Drug Concentration-time Curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken 20 to 45 min and 4 to 8 hours post injection. AUC calculated from time of injection to infinity.
primary_outcome.description: AUC = Area under the drug concentration-time curve from administration to infinity

primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken at 20 to 45 min and at 4 to 8 hours post injection; t 1/2 calculated from area under the drug concentration-time curve from administration to infinity
primary_outcome.description: t 1/2 = termination elimination half-life calculated from the area under the drug concentration-time curve from administration to infinity

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Number of Lesions Detected - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator; unenh. image = unenhanced image; comb. image= combined unenhanced and enhanced image. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the number of participants with 0, 1, 2, and 3 or more lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Number of Lesions Detected - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator; unenh. image = unenhanced image; comb. image= combined unenhanced and enhanced image. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the number of participants with 0, 1, 2, and 3 or more lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Quality of Lesion Visualization - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of lesion visualization with the unenhanced and the combined image sets based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - lesion clearly seen and diagnosis possible; 2=fair but adequate - most of lesion seen and diagnosis possible; and 3=poor - lesion barely seen and diagnosis not possible)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Quality of Lesion Visualization - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of lesion visualization with the unenhanced and the combined image sets based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - lesion clearly seen and diagnosis possible; 2=fair but adequate - most of lesion seen and diagnosis possible; and 3=poor - lesion barely seen and diagnosis not possible)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Quality of Border Delineation - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of border delineation based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - border completely delineated; 2=fair but adequate - some of the border is delineated; and 3=poor - entire or almost the entire border is not delineated) by image set

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Quality of Border Delineation - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of border delineation based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - border completely delineated; 2=fair but adequate - some of the border is delineated; and 3=poor - entire or almost the entire border is not delineated) by image set

secondary_outcome.measure: Most Frequent Diagnostic Findings With Unenhanced Images - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the most frequent diagnostic findings with the unenhanced images

secondary_outcome.measure: Most Frequent Diagnostic Findings With Unenhanced Images - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the most frequent diagnostic findings with the unenhanced images

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Number of Participants With Change in Diagnosis From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the number of participants with a change in diagnosis from unenhanced to combined images. BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Number of Participants With Change in Diagnosis From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the number of participants with a change in diagnosis from unenhanced to combined images. BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Specific Change in the Diagnosis From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: Those participants for whom the diagnosis changed for at least 1 Blinded Reader from unenhanced to combined images are presented for Stage 1. For completeness, the corresponding data for these participants are presented for the open-label Clinical Investigators. BR=Blinded Reader; CI=Clinical Investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Specific Change in the Diagnosis From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: Those participants for whom the diagnosis changed for at least 1 Blinded Reader from unenhanced to combined images are presented for Stage 2. For completeness, the corresponding data for these participants are presented for the open-label Clinical Investigators. BR=Blinded Reader; CI=Clinical Investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Diagnostic Confidence - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: The overall diagnostic confidence of the Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators was indicated on a 3-point scale: 1=not confident; 2=confident; and 3=very confident. BR=Blinder Reader; CI=Clinical Investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Diagnostic Confidence - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: The overall diagnostic confidence of the Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators was indicated on a 3-point scale: 1=not confident; 2=confident; and 3=very confident. BR=Blinder Reader; CI=Clinical Investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Management Based on Unenhanced Images - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: For Stage 1 based on unenhanced images, the recommended management is presented as determined by the open-label Clinical Investigators.

secondary_outcome.measure: Management Based on Unenhanced Images - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: For Stage 2 based on unenhanced images, the recommended management is presented as determined by the open-label Clinical Investigators.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Number of Participants With Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: For Stage 1, the number of participants for whom the recommended management of the open-label Clinical Investigators changed from unenhanced to combined images is presented for both doses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Number of Participants With Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: For Stage 2, the number of participants for whom the recommended management of the open-label Clinical Investigators changed from unenhanced to combined images is presented for the optimal efficacious dose determined in Stage 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Specific Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
secondary_outcome.description: The actual change in management from unenhanced to combined images recommended by the open-label Clinical Investigators is presented for both doses in Stage 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Specific Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 2
secondary_outcome.description: The actual change in management from unenhanced to combined images recommended by the open-label Clinical Investigators is presented in Stage 2 for the optimal efficacious dose determined in Stage 1

arm_group.description: For stage 1: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Magnevist. Upon completion of the MR imaging, the participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW). For stage 2: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

intervention.description: For stage 1: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Magnevist. Upon completion of the MR imaging, the participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW). For stage 2: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: 2 months to < 2 years (23 months)
- Participants (male/female) who are scheduled to undergo gadolinium-enhanced MRI
- Able to comply with the study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical unstable participants (eg, intensive care unit)
- Renal Insufficiency
- Participants undergoing chemotherapy </= 48 hours prior to and up to 24 hours after the administration of Magnevist.

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.
Click here to find information about studies related to Bayer Healthcare products conducted in Europe

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The date of the first participant, first visit was 21 Jan 2010. The date of the last participant, last visit was 09 Sep 2010. The date of the Blinded Read for Stage 1 was 27 Apr 2010. the date of the Blinded Read for Stage 2 was 08 Sep 2010
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A subject was enrolled in EITHER Stage 1 or Stage 2 and not both. Overall for both stages, 61 participants were Screened, 7 were Screen Failures, and 54 participants were enrolled and treated of which 53 participants completed the study (20 unique participants in Stage 1 and 33 unique participants in Stage 2)

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine (Magnevist, BAY86-6661)
group.description: For Stage 1: participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Magnevist. Upon completion of the MR imaging, the participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW). For Stage 2: Another group of participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

participants_list.participants: Valid for Full Analysis Set (FAS); includes all participants administered Magnevist Injection
Stage 1 and Stage 2 are independent each enrolling a different set of participants
Valid for Full Analysis Set; participants administered correct Magnevist dose based on body weight
The number completed includes participants within the FAS and Per Protocol Set (PPS)

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine (Magnevist, BAY86-6661) - Stage 1
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Magnevist. Upon completion of the MR imaging, the participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW).

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine (Magnevist, BAY86-6661) – Stage 2
group.description: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Body Weight

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Diagnostic Adequacy - Open-label Clinical Investigators (Per Protocol Set)
outcome.description: A clinical judgment by the open-label Clinical Investigators (CIs) as to whether ("yes") or not ("no") the CI could make a diagnosis from the image.
outcome.population: The first 3 participants of Stage 1 received 2 IV injections of 0.05 mmol/kg body weight (BW), images were obtained after each injection and an assessment made by the CIs as to diagnostic adequacy.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Comb. Image 0.05 mmol/kg)
group.description: Participants (n=3) received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Comb. Image 0.1 mmol/kg)
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine. Participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Diagnostic Adequacy - Open-label Clinical Investigators (Per Protocol Set)
measure.description: A clinical judgment by the open-label Clinical Investigators (CIs) as to whether ("yes") or not ("no") the CI could make a diagnosis from the image.
measure.population: The first 3 participants of Stage 1 received 2 IV injections of 0.05 mmol/kg body weight (BW), images were obtained after each injection and an assessment made by the CIs as to diagnostic adequacy.

outcome.description: Dose superiority was a calculation based upon the Blinder Readers' assessment of 4 visualization parameters
outcome.population: Primary analysis set (the first 5 PPS participants in each age group)

measure.description: For each participant, the Blinded Reader indicated which dose had better contrast enhancement, better border delineation, clearer internal morphology, and provided more diagnostic information. outcome.title: PK Analysis - Total Clearance (CL)
outcome.description: Total clearance is the fraction of the volume of distribution (Vd) which is completely purified per unit of time and depends also on the plasma half-life of the drug.
outcome.time_frame: 20 to 45 min and 4 to 8 hours post injection
outcome.population: PK population (N=44) was based on the Per Protocol Set (PPS) defined for Stage 1 as all participants (n=18) who received the appropriate dose of Magnevist Injection based on kg body weight (BW) and in Stage 2 as those participants (n=26) who received +/- 10% of the appropriate dose based on kg BW and had values for both PK samples

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 and 2
group.description: For Stage 1: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Magnevist. Upon completion of the MR imaging, the participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW). For Stage 2: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

measure.population: PK population (N=44) was based on the Per Protocol Set (PPS) defined for Stage 1 as all participants (n=18) who received the appropriate dose of Magnevist Injection based on kg body weight (BW) and in Stage 2 as those participants (n=26) who received +/- 10% of the appropriate dose based on kg BW and had values for both PK samples

group.description: Unenhanced image was taken before given any injection to Participants.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Number of Lesions Detected - Stage 1
measure.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator; unenh. image = unenhanced image; comb. image= combined unenhanced and enhanced image. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the number of participants with 0, 1, 2, and 3 or more lesions.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Quality of Lesion Visualization - Stage 1
outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of lesion visualization with the unenhanced and the combined image sets based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - lesion clearly seen and diagnosis possible; 2=fair but adequate - most of lesion seen and diagnosis possible; and 3=poor - lesion barely seen and diagnosis not possible)

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Unenh. Image)
group.description: Unenhanced image was taken before given any injection to Participants.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Comb. Image 0.05 mmol/kg)
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Comb. Image 0.1 mmol/kg)
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine. participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Quality of Lesion Visualization - Stage 1
measure.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of lesion visualization with the unenhanced and the combined image sets based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - lesion clearly seen and diagnosis possible; 2=fair but adequate - most of lesion seen and diagnosis possible; and 3=poor - lesion barely seen and diagnosis not possible)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Quality of Lesion Visualization - Stage 2
outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of lesion visualization with the unenhanced and the combined image sets based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - lesion clearly seen and diagnosis possible; 2=fair but adequate - most of lesion seen and diagnosis possible; and 3=poor - lesion barely seen and diagnosis not possible)

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 2 (Unenh. Image)
group.description: Unenhanced image was taken before given any injection to Participants.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 2 (Comb. Image)
group.description: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Quality of Lesion Visualization - Stage 2
measure.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of lesion visualization with the unenhanced and the combined image sets based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - lesion clearly seen and diagnosis possible; 2=fair but adequate - most of lesion seen and diagnosis possible; and 3=poor - lesion barely seen and diagnosis not possible)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Quality of Border Delineation - Stage 1
outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of border delineation based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - border completely delineated; 2=fair but adequate - some of the border is delineated; and 3=poor - entire or almost the entire border is not delineated) by image set

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Unenh. Image)
group.description: Unenhanced image was taken before given any injection to Participants.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Comb. Image 0.05 mmol/kg)
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine.

group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine. participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Quality of Border Delineation - Stage 1
measure.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the quality of border delineation based on a 3-point scale (1=excellent - border completely delineated; 2=fair but adequate - some of the border is delineated; and 3=poor - entire or almost the entire border is not delineated) by image set

outcome.title: Most Frequent Diagnostic Findings With Unenhanced Images - Stage 1
outcome.description: BR = blinded reader; CI = clinical investigator. The Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators determined the most frequent diagnostic findings with the unenhanced images

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Specific Change in the Diagnosis From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
outcome.description: Those participants for whom the diagnosis changed for at least 1 Blinded Reader from unenhanced to combined images are presented for Stage 1. For completeness, the corresponding data for these participants are presented for the open-label Clinical Investigators. BR=Blinded Reader; CI=Clinical Investigator.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Diagnostic Confidence - Stage 1
outcome.description: The overall diagnostic confidence of the Blinded Readers and the open-label Clinical Investigators was indicated on a 3-point scale: 1=not confident; 2=confident; and 3=very confident. BR=Blinder Reader; CI=Clinical Investigator

outcome.title: Management Based on Unenhanced Images - Stage 1
outcome.description: For Stage 1 based on unenhanced images, the recommended management is presented as determined by the open-label Clinical Investigators.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (only participants for whom information on management was given)

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Magnevist. Upon completion of the MR imaging, the participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW).

outcome.title: Overall Number of Participants With Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
outcome.description: For Stage 1, the number of participants for whom the recommended management of the open-label Clinical Investigators changed from unenhanced to combined images is presented for both doses.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Comb. Image 0.05 mmol/kg)
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine.

measure.title: Overall Number of Participants With Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
measure.description: For Stage 1, the number of participants for whom the recommended management of the open-label Clinical Investigators changed from unenhanced to combined images is presented for both doses.

outcome.title: Overall Number of Participants With Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 2
outcome.description: For Stage 2, the number of participants for whom the recommended management of the open-label Clinical Investigators changed from unenhanced to combined images is presented for the optimal efficacious dose determined in Stage 1.

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 2
group.description: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Specific Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
outcome.description: The actual change in management from unenhanced to combined images recommended by the open-label Clinical Investigators is presented for both doses in Stage 1

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1 (Comb. Image 0.05 mmol/kg)
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Gadopentetate dimeglumine.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Specific Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 1
measure.description: The actual change in management from unenhanced to combined images recommended by the open-label Clinical Investigators is presented for both doses in Stage 1

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Specific Change in Management From Unenhanced to Combined Images - Stage 2
outcome.description: The actual change in management from unenhanced to combined images recommended by the open-label Clinical Investigators is presented in Stage 2 for the optimal efficacious dose determined in Stage 1

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 2
group.description: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

measure.description: The actual change in management from unenhanced to combined images recommended by the open-label Clinical Investigators is presented in Stage 2 for the optimal efficacious dose determined in Stage 1

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 1
group.description: Participants received an IV injection of 0.05 mmol/kg Body Weight (BW) (0.1 mL/kg BW) Magnevist. Upon completion of the MR imaging, the participants received another injection of 0.05 mmol/kg for a total cumulative dose of 0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW).

group.title: Gadopentetate Dimeglumine - Stage 2
group.description: Participants received the optimal efficacious dose established in Stage 1 as a single IV injection of Magnevist Injection (0.1 mmol/kg BW (0.2 mL/kg BW)).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
